results.title: Paddington lace
results.creator_credit: Chris McCullough, David Bairstow and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Paddington is one of Sydney’s oldest suburbs, which has developed somewhat along the lines of New York’s Greenwich Village or London’s Chelsea and has become Sydney’s artist colony. This is a fully dramatised film, which captures the essence of Paddington, not only by striking visuals of the Old-Sydney architecture in the area, but by re-enacting the mood and lifestyle of some typical, bohemian inhabitants. Scripted by Joan Long. Music by Grahame Bond and Rory O’Donaghue. Starring Ross Thompson, Janne Wesley and Ron Blanchard.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Chris McCullough, David Bairstow and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: Icarus
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Antonio Colacino, Don Murray, Film Australia and Outlook
results.brief_description: Man, it seems, has long craved to fly as the birds fly, silently propelled only by the forces of nature. Some get towed aloft in large gliders; others, like flying men harnessed to flimsy wings, launch themselves from wind swept cliff tops. Icarus is a view of both forms of the gliding sport in which the viewer gains the same sense of freedom, of elevation above the problems of the earthbound as do the men who choose to gain recreation in this exciting way. No spoken commentary.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Antonio Colacino, Don Murray, Film Australia and Outlook

results.title: Autumn of a mining town
results.creator_credit: Phillip Mark-Law, Joe Scully and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Perhaps due to its fascinating past and equally astonishing present, the Victorian gold rush town of Ballarat catches the quintessence of Victorian Australia - the curious old homes; the old tramcars; the coffee palace; the Cobb & Co office; the gardens and the people. No narration. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Workout
results.creator_credit: Rhonda Small and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: An impressionistic study of the relationship between horse and rider during a work out. To compete in Olympic equestrian events young riders must practice daily, sharpening their own skill and that of their horses. Shows the world as it must appear to horse and rider on a foggy morning in the Australian bush.

results.title: Wool Fashion Awards 1967
results.brief_description: Models are posed against a variety of Melbourne’s buildings such as Melbourne University, Fitzroy Gardens, National Gallery of Victoria…both interior and exterior backgrounds are used. We see the award winning garments: slack suits, lounging pyjamas, coats and dresses for both day and evening wear.

results.title: [Wool Fashion Awards 1965]
results.brief_description: Photographed against a background of Montsalvat at Eltham and Melbourne University, models pose in award winning day and evening wear: dresses, suits, skirts and informal wear.

results.title: Wide pastures
results.creator_credit: Robert Kingsbury, Eric Thompson and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Australia’s most enduring industry is the development, breeding and grazing of the Australian merino sheep. A pastoral revolution based on land clearing, top-dressing and irrigation is increasing sheep production over vast new areas, but the traditional outback has hardly changed since farmers went inland to find sheep country.

results.title: Who's to blame
results.creator_credit: Commonwealth Department of Transport, Film Australia and Telemark Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Skills of Defensive Driving”.
Attempts to allocate responsibility for the accidents on our roads by showing common driving faults

results.title: Where are we heading
results.creator_credit: Arch Nicholson, Gil Brealey, Dept of Health and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Presents an open-ended look at the effects that different parental attitudes to life and the family unit have on adolescents. Directed mainly at adult audiences, especially parents and community leaders. Note: Restricted to tertiary institutions, teaching hospitals, police and customs departments.

results.title: When will the birds return
results.creator_credit: Bob Kingsbury, John Carter, Peter Johnson and Film Australia
results.brief_description: A television special that takes a long and searching look at the devastation of the city of Darwin in Australia’s Northern Territory after Cyclone Tracy on 25th december 1974. The city became the site of possibly the greatest natural disaster in the nation’s history causing the mass evacuation south of three-quarters of the city’s 43,000 people. The film looks at the results of the cyclone and the spirit of the people of Darwin, determined to rebuild their city.
